001package squidpony.squidgrid.gui.gdx;

003import com.badlogic.gdx.Gdx;
004import com.badlogic.gdx.assets.AssetDescriptor;
005import com.badlogic.gdx.assets.AssetManager;
006import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color;
007import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Pixmap;
008import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Texture;
009import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch;
010import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.BitmapFont;
011import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion;
012import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ShaderProgram;
013import com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Actor;
014import com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.Image;
015import com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.Label;
016import com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Align;
017import com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Disposable;
018import regexodus.ds.CharCharMap;
019import squidpony.IColorCenter;
020import squidpony.Maker;

025import java.util.ArrayList;
026import java.util.Collection;
027
028/**
029 * Class for creating text blocks.
030 *
031 * This class defaults to having no padding and having no font set. You can use a
032 * default square or narrow font by calling the appropriate method, or set the font
033 * to any AngelCode bitmap font on the classpath (typically in libGDX, this would be
034 * in the assets folder; these fonts can be created by Hiero in the libGDX tools,
035 * see https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/wiki/Hiero for more)
036 *
037 * After all settings are set, one of the initialization methods must be called
038 * before the factory can be used.
039 *
040 * In order to easily support Unicode, strings are treated as a series of code
041 * points.
042 *
043 * All images have transparent backgrounds.
044 *
045 * @author Eben Howard - http://squidpony.com - howard@squidpony.com
046 * @author Tommy Ettinger
047 */
048public class TextCellFactory implements Disposable {
049
050    /**
051     * How many styles are supported by this TextCellFactory; always 1 unless changed in a subclass.
052     */
053    public int supportedStyles() {
054        return 1;
055    }
056    /**
057     * The commonly used symbols in roguelike games.
058     */
059    public static final String DEFAULT_FITTING =
060            " !\"#$%&'()*+,-./0123456789:;<=>?@ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ[\\]^_`abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz{|}~";
061    /**
062     * All symbols that squidlib-util permits itself to generate; this is a shared subset across most of the larger
063     * fonts in {@link DefaultResources}.
064     */
065    public static final String SQUID_FITTING = StringKit.PERMISSIBLE_CHARS;
066    /**
067     * The {@link AssetManager} from where to load the font. Use it to share
068     * loading of a font's file across multiple factories.
069     */
070    protected /* Nullable */AssetManager assetManager;
071    public BitmapFont bmpFont;
072    protected TextureRegion block;
073    protected TextureRegion dirMarker;
074    protected String fitting = SQUID_FITTING;
075    protected IColorCenter<Color> scc;
076    protected int leftPadding, rightPadding, topPadding, bottomPadding;
077    protected float width = 1, height = 1;
078    public float actualCellWidth = 1, actualCellHeight = 1;
079    protected float distanceFieldScaleX = 36f, distanceFieldScaleY = 36f;
080    protected boolean initialized, initializedByFont, initializedBySize;
081    protected boolean distanceField;
082    protected boolean msdf;
083    /**
084     * For distance field and MSDF fonts, this is the ShaderProgram that will produce the intended effect.
085     * Usually should not be changed manually unless you know what you are doing.
086     */
087    public ShaderProgram shader;
088    protected float smoothingMultiplier = 1.2f;
089    protected float descent, lineHeight;
090    protected Label.LabelStyle style;
091    protected CharCharMap swap = new CharCharMap(8);
092    protected char directionGlyph = '^';
093    protected OrderedMap<Character, TextureRegion> glyphTextures = new OrderedMap<>(16);
094
095    protected StringBuilder mut = new StringBuilder(1).append('\0');
096
097    /**
098     * Creates a default valued factory. One of the initialization methods must
099     * be called before this factory can be used!
100     */
101    public TextCellFactory() {
102        this(null);
103    }
104
105    /**
106     * A default valued factory that uses the given {@link AssetManager} to load
107     * the font file. Use this constructor if you are likely to load the same
108     * font over and over (recall that, without an {@link AssetManager}, each
109     * instance of {@link TextCellFactory} will load its font from disk). This
110     * primarily matters if you are using fonts not bundled with SquidLib, since
111     * accessing a BitmapFont with a method (not a String) from DefaultResources
112     * caches the BitmapFont already.
113     *
114     * @param assetManager an ordinary libGDX AssetManager
115     */
116    public TextCellFactory(/* Nullable */ AssetManager assetManager) {
117        this.assetManager = assetManager;
118        scc = DefaultResources.getSCC();
119        swap.defaultReturnValue('\uffff');
120        swap.put('\u0006', ' ');
121    }
122
123    public TextCellFactory copy()
124    {
125        TextCellFactory next = new TextCellFactory(assetManager);
126        if(bmpFont == null)
127            bmpFont = DefaultResources.getIncludedFont();
128        next.bmpFont = DefaultResources.copyFont(bmpFont);
129        next.block = block;
130        next.swap.clear();
131        next.swap.defaultReturnValue(swap.defaultReturnValue);
132        next.swap.putAll(swap);
133        next.distanceField = distanceField;
134        next.msdf = msdf;
135        next.distanceFieldScaleX = distanceFieldScaleX;
136        next.distanceFieldScaleY = distanceFieldScaleY;
137        next.shader = null;
138        next.fitting = fitting;
139        next.height = height;
140        next.width = width;
141        next.actualCellWidth = actualCellWidth;
142        next.actualCellHeight = actualCellHeight;
143        next.descent = descent;
144        next.lineHeight = lineHeight;
145        next.smoothingMultiplier = smoothingMultiplier;
146        next.scc = scc;
147        next.directionGlyph = directionGlyph;
148        if(initializedBySize)
149            next.initBySize();
150        else if(initializedByFont)
151            next.initByFont();
152        return next;
153    }
154
155    /**
156     * Returns a String containing all chars in the font (not considering the missing glyph).
157     * @param font a BitmapFont that will not be changed
158     * @return a String containing all chars in the font
159     */
160    public static String getGlyphs(BitmapFont font) {
161        BitmapFont.BitmapFontData data = font.getData();
162        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder(512);
163        for (int index = 0, end = 65536; index < end; index++) {
164            if (data.getGlyph((char) index) != null)
165                sb.append((char) index);
166        }
167        return sb.toString();
168    }
169
170    /**
171     * Sets all glyphs in the given BitmapFont to be fixed-width and have an xadvance
172     * equal to the largest width for any glyph in the font. This returns a String
173     * containing all chars in the font (not considering the missing glyph).
174     * @param font a BitmapFont that will be modified in-place
175     * @return a String containing all chars in the font
176     */
177    public static String setAllFixedWidth(BitmapFont font) {
178        BitmapFont.BitmapFontData data = font.getData();
179        int maxAdvance = 0;
180        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder(512);
181        for (int index = 0, end = 65536; index < end; index++) {
182            BitmapFont.Glyph g = data.getGlyph((char) index);
183            if (g != null && g.xadvance > maxAdvance) maxAdvance = g.xadvance;
184        }
185        for (int index = 0, end = 65536; index < end; index++) {
186            BitmapFont.Glyph g = data.getGlyph((char) index);
187            if (g == null) continue;
188            g.xoffset += (maxAdvance - g.xadvance) / 2;
189            g.xadvance = maxAdvance;
190            g.kerning = null;
191            g.fixedWidth = true;
192            sb.append((char) index);
193        }
194        return sb.toString();
195    }
196
197    /**
198     * Initializes the factory to then be able to create text cells on demand.
199     * This is not usually the method you want; {@link #initBySize()} is used
200     * almost always instead of this method. This can be used when you don't
201     * care what size the font actually will be, and are fine delegating that
202     * responsibility to any initial configuration in the given BitmapFont.
203     * <br>
204     * Will match the width and height to the space width of the font and the
205     * line height of the font, respectively. Calling this after the factory
206     * has already been initialized will re-initialize it. This will not work
207     * with distance field or MSDF fonts; for those, use {@link #initBySize()}.
208     * <br>
209     * This sets the fitting (accessible by {@link #fit()}) to a String
210     * containing all chars in the font, and makes all chars fixed-width.
211     *
212     * @return this for method chaining
213     */
214    public TextCellFactory initByFont() {
215        if(bmpFont == null)
216            bmpFont = DefaultResources.getIncludedFont();
217        fitAll();
218        lineHeight = bmpFont.getLineHeight();
219        height = (lineHeight);
220        descent = bmpFont.getDescent();
221
222        actualCellWidth = width;
223        actualCellHeight = height;
224        BitmapFont.Glyph g = bmpFont.getData().missingGlyph;
225        if(g != null)
226        {
227            block = new TextureRegion(bmpFont.getRegion(), g.srcX + 1, g.srcY + 1, 1, 1);
228        }
229        else {
230            Pixmap temp = new Pixmap(1, 1, Pixmap.Format.RGBA8888);
231            temp.setColor(Color.WHITE);
232            temp.fill();
233            Texture white = new Texture(1, 1, Pixmap.Format.RGBA8888);
234            white.draw(temp, 0, 0);
235            block = new TextureRegion(white);
236            temp.dispose();
237        }
238        style = new Label.LabelStyle(bmpFont, null);
239        BitmapFont.Glyph dg = bmpFont.getData().getGlyph(directionGlyph);
240        if(dg != null)
241            dirMarker = new TextureRegion(bmpFont.getRegion(dg.page), dg.srcX, dg.srcY, dg.width, dg.height);
242        initialized = true;
243        initializedByFont = true;
244        return this;
245    }
246
247    /**
248     * Initializes the factory to then be able to create text cells on demand.
249     * <br>
250     * Will strictly use the provided width and height values to size the cells.
251     * Calling this after the factory has already been initialized will
252     * re-initialize it, but will re-create several objects (including compiling
253     * a ShaderProgram, which can be very challenging for a GPU to do each frame).
254     * If you need to re-initialize often to adjust size, use {@link #resetSize()},
255     * which does not allocate new objects if this was already initialized, and
256     * will just delegate to this method if this wasn't initialized.
257     * <br>
258     * You may want to call {@link #fit(String)} or {@link #fitAll()} to ensure
259     * that chars are rendered with fixed-width, which mostly affects any gaps at
260     * the left side of a char. Using fitAll() either before or after calling
261     * this is recommended.
262     *
263     * @return this for method chaining
264     */
265    public TextCellFactory initBySize() {
266        if(bmpFont == null)
267            bmpFont = DefaultResources.getIncludedFont();
268        BitmapFont.Glyph g = bmpFont.getData().missingGlyph;
269        if(g != null)
270        {
271            block = new TextureRegion(bmpFont.getRegion(), g.srcX + 1, g.srcY + 1, 1, 1);
272        }
273        else {
274            Pixmap temp = new Pixmap(1, 1, Pixmap.Format.RGBA8888);
275            temp.setColor(Color.WHITE);
276            temp.fill();
277            Texture white = new Texture(1, 1, Pixmap.Format.RGBA8888);
278            white.draw(temp, 0, 0);
279            block = new TextureRegion(white);
280            temp.dispose();
281        }
282        if(msdf)
283        {
284            bmpFont.getData().setScale(width / distanceFieldScaleX, height / distanceFieldScaleY);
285
286            shader = new ShaderProgram(DefaultResources.vertexShader, DefaultResources.msdfFragmentShader);
287            if (!shader.isCompiled()) {
288                Gdx.app.error("shader", "Distance Field font shader compilation failed:\n" + shader.getLog());
289            }
290            //lineTweak = lineHeight / 20f;
291            //distanceFieldScaleX *= (((float)width) / height) / (distanceFieldScaleX / distanceFieldScaleY);
292        }
293        else if(distanceField)
294        {
295            bmpFont.getData().setScale(width / distanceFieldScaleX, height / distanceFieldScaleY);
296
297            shader = new ShaderProgram(DefaultResources.vertexShader, DefaultResources.fragmentShader);
298            if (!shader.isCompiled()) {
299                Gdx.app.error("shader", "Distance Field font shader compilation failed:\n" + shader.getLog());
300            }
301        }
302        else {
303            shader = FilterBatch.createDefaultShader();
304        }
305        lineHeight = bmpFont.getLineHeight();
306        descent = bmpFont.getDescent();
307        style = new Label.LabelStyle(bmpFont, null);
308        BitmapFont.Glyph dg = bmpFont.getData().getGlyph(directionGlyph);
309        if(dg != null)
310            dirMarker = new TextureRegion(bmpFont.getRegion(dg.page), dg.srcX, dg.srcY, dg.width, dg.height);
311        initialized = true;
312        initializedBySize = true;
313        return this;
314    }
315
316    /**
317     * Acts like calling {@link #initBySize()}, but doesn't create new ShaderPrograms or other objects if this has
318     * already been initialized. If this has not been initialized, simply returns initBySize(). This method is safe to
319     * call every frame if the font size continually changes, where initBySize() is not.
320     * @return this for chaining
321     */
322    public TextCellFactory resetSize()
323    {
324        return resetSize(width, height);
325    }
326
327    /**
328     * Acts like calling {@link #width(float)}, {@link #height(float)}, and {@link #initBySize()} in succession, but
329     * doesn't create new ShaderPrograms or other objects if this has already been initialized. If this has not been
330     * initialized, calls width() and height() and then simply returns initBySize(). This method is safe to call every
331     * frame if the font size continually changes, where initBySize() is not.
332     * @param newWidth the new width of a single cell, as a float that usually corresponds to pixels
333     * @param newHeight the new height of a single cell, as a float that usually corresponds to pixels
334     * @return this for chaining
335     */
336    public TextCellFactory resetSize(final float newWidth, final float newHeight)
337    {
338        width(newWidth);
339        height(newHeight);
340        if(!initialized)
341            return initBySize();
342        if(msdf || distanceField)
343        {
344            bmpFont.getData().setScale(width / distanceFieldScaleX, height / distanceFieldScaleY);
345        }
346
347        lineHeight = bmpFont.getLineHeight();
348        descent = bmpFont.getDescent();
349
350        return this;
351    }
352
353    /**
354     * Identical to {@link #initBySize()}.
355     *
356     * @see #initBySize() The docs for initBySize() apply here.
357     * @return this for method chaining
358     */
359    public TextCellFactory initVerbatim() {
360        return initBySize();
361    }
362
363    /**
364     * Returns the {@link BitmapFont} used by this factory.
365     *
366     * @return the BitmapFont this uses
367     */
368    public BitmapFont font() {
369        return bmpFont;
370    }
371
372    /**
373     * Sets this factory to use the provided font.
374     *
375     * This is a way to complete a needed step; the font must be set before initializing, which can be done by a few
376     * methods in this class.
377     *
378     * This should be called with an argument such as "Rogue-Zodiac-6x12.fnt", that is, it should have the .fnt
379     * extension as opposed to the .png that accompanies such a bitmap font. The bitmap font should be either in the
380     * internal folder that libGDX knows about, which means it is in the assets folder of your project usually.
381     * These BitmapFont resources are already known by SquidLib, but may need separate downloads (detailed in the linked
382     * DefaultResources documentation):
383     * <ul>
384     *     <li>{@link DefaultResources#getDefaultFont()} = "Zodiac-Square-12x12.fnt"</li>
385     *     <li>{@link DefaultResources#getDefaultNarrowFont()} = "Rogue-Zodiac-6x12.fnt"</li>
386     *     <li>{@link DefaultResources#getDefaultUnicodeFont()} = "Mandrill-6x16.fnt"</li>
387     *     <li>{@link DefaultResources#getSmoothFont()} = "Inconsolata-LGC-8x18.fnt"</li>
388     *     <li>{@link DefaultResources#getLargeFont()} = "Zodiac-Square-24x24.fnt"</li>
389     *     <li>{@link DefaultResources#getLargeNarrowFont()} = "Rogue-Zodiac-12x24.fnt"</li>
390     *     <li>{@link DefaultResources#getLargeUnicodeFont()} = "Mandrill-12x32.fnt"</li>
391     *     <li>{@link DefaultResources#getLargeSmoothFont()} = "Inconsolata-LGC-12x24.fnt"</li>
392     *     <li>{@link DefaultResources#getExtraLargeNarrowFont()} = "Rogue-Zodiac-18x36.fnt"</li>
393     * </ul>
394     * "Rogue-Zodiac-12x24.fnt", which is easily accessed by the field DefaultResources.narrowNameLarge , can also
395     * be set using TextCellFactory.defaultNarrowFont() instead of font(). "Zodiac-Square-12x12.fnt", also accessible
396     * as DefaultResources.squareName , can be set using TextCellFactory.defaultSquareFont() instead of font().
397     * "Inconsolata-LGC-12x24.fnt", also accessible as DefaultResources.smoothNameLarge , can be set using
398     * TextCellFactory.defaultFont() instead of font(). All three of these alternatives will cache the BitmapFont if
399     * the same one is requested later, but this font() method will not.
400     * <br>
401     * See https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/wiki/Hiero for some ways to create a bitmap font this can use. Several fonts
402     * in this list were created using Hiero (not Hiero4), and several were created with AngelCode's BMFont tool.
403     *
404     * @param fontpath the path to the font to use
405     * @return this factory for method chaining
406     */
407    public TextCellFactory font(String fontpath) {
408        if (assetManager == null) {
409            if (Gdx.files.internal(fontpath).exists())
410                bmpFont = new BitmapFont(Gdx.files.internal(fontpath));
411            else if (Gdx.files.classpath(fontpath).exists())
412                bmpFont = new BitmapFont(Gdx.files.classpath(fontpath));
413            else
414                bmpFont = DefaultResources.getIncludedFont();
415        }
416        else {
417            assetManager.load(new AssetDescriptor<>(fontpath, BitmapFont.class));
418            /*
419             * We're using the AssetManager not be asynchronous, but to avoid
420             * loading a file twice (because that takes some time (tens of
421             * milliseconds)). Hence this KISS code to avoid having to handle a
422             * not-yet-loaded font:
423             */
424            assetManager.finishLoading();
425            bmpFont = assetManager.get(fontpath, BitmapFont.class);
426        }
427        return this;
428    }
429    /**
430     * Sets this factory to use the provided BitmapFont as its font without re-constructing anything.
431     *
432     * This is a way to complete a needed step; the font must be set before initializing, which can be done by a few
433     * methods in this class.
434     *
435     * This should be called with an argument such as {@code DefaultResources.getDefaultFont()} or any other variable
436     * with BitmapFont as its type. The bitmap font will not be loaded from file with this method, which it would be if
437     * you called the overload of font() that takes a String more than once. These BitmapFont resources are already
438     * known by SquidLib, but may need separate downloads (detailed in the linked DefaultResources documentation):
439     * <ul>
440     *     <li>{@link DefaultResources#getDefaultFont()} = "Zodiac-Square-12x12.fnt"</li>
441     *     <li>{@link DefaultResources#getDefaultNarrowFont()} = "Rogue-Zodiac-6x12.fnt"</li>
442     *     <li>{@link DefaultResources#getDefaultUnicodeFont()} = "Mandrill-6x16.fnt"</li>
443     *     <li>{@link DefaultResources#getSmoothFont()} = "Inconsolata-LGC-8x18.fnt"</li>
444     *     <li>{@link DefaultResources#getLargeFont()} = "Zodiac-Square-24x24.fnt"</li>
445     *     <li>{@link DefaultResources#getLargeNarrowFont()} = "Rogue-Zodiac-12x24.fnt"</li>
446     *     <li>{@link DefaultResources#getLargeUnicodeFont()} = "Mandrill-12x32.fnt"</li>
447     *     <li>{@link DefaultResources#getLargeSmoothFont()} = "Inconsolata-LGC-12x24.fnt"</li>
448     *     <li>{@link DefaultResources#getExtraLargeNarrowFont()} = "Rogue-Zodiac-18x36.fnt"</li>
449     * </ul>
450     * "Rogue-Zodiac-12x24.fnt", which is easily accessed by the method DefaultResources.getLargeNarrowFont() , can also
451     * be set using TextCellFactory.defaultNarrowFont() instead of font(). "Zodiac-Square-12x12.fnt", also accessible
452     * with DefaultResources.getDefaultFont() , can be set using TextCellFactory.defaultSquareFont() instead of font().
453     * "Inconsolata-LGC-12x24.fnt", also accessible with DefaultResources.getLargeSmoothFont() , can be set using
454     * TextCellFactory.defaultFont() instead of font(). All three of these alternatives will cache the BitmapFont if
455     * the same one is requested later, but this font() method will not.
456     * <br>
457     * See https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/wiki/Hiero for some ways to create a bitmap font this can use. Several fonts
458     * in this list were created using Hiero (not Hiero4), and several were created with AngelCode's BMFont tool.
459     *
460     * @param bitmapFont the BitmapFont this should use
461     * @return this factory for method chaining
462     */
463    public TextCellFactory font(BitmapFont bitmapFont) {
464        if (bitmapFont == null) {
465            bmpFont = DefaultResources.getIncludedFont();
466        }
467        else {
468            bmpFont = bitmapFont;
469        }
470        return this;
471    }
472
473    /**
474     * Sets the font to a distance field font with the given String path to a .fnt file and String path to a texture.
475     * Distance field fonts should scale cleanly to multiple resolutions without artifacts. Does not use AssetManager
476     * since you shouldn't need to reload the font if it scales with one image. You need to configure the shader to use
477     * distance field fonts unless a class already does this for you (SquidLayers handles shader configuration
478     * internally, for example). TextCellFactory has a method, configureShader(Batch), that does this and should be
479     * called while that Batch has begun rendering, typically in an override of some containing Scene2D Group's
480     * draw(Batch, float) method.
481     * <br>
482     * At least two distance field fonts are included in SquidLib; one is square, one is narrow, and they can both be
483     * accessed using either the predefined TextCellFactory objects in DefaultResources, accessible with
484     * getStretchableFont() for narrow or getStretchableSquareFont() for square, or the setter methods in this class,
485     * defaultDistanceFieldFont() for square and defaultNarrowDistanceFieldFont() for narrow.
486     * <br>
487     * To create distance field fonts that work well with monospace layout is... time-consuming and error-prone, though
488     * not especially difficult for most fonts. The process is documented as well as we can, given how differently all
489     * fonts are made, in a file not included in the distribution JAR but present on GitHub:
490     * <a href="https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/squidlib/etc/making-distance-field-fonts.txt">Instructions here</a>.
491     * A separate project is dedicated to automating this process somewhat,
492     * <a href="https://github.com/tommyettinger/Glamer">Glamer</a>; Glamer can also produce MSDF fonts.
493     * @param fontPath the path to a .fnt bitmap font file with distance field effects applied, which requires a complex
494     *                 process to create.
495     * @param texturePath the path to the texture used by the bitmap font
496     * @return this factory for method chaining
497     */
498    public TextCellFactory fontDistanceField(String fontPath, String texturePath) {
499        Texture tex;
500        if (Gdx.files.internal(texturePath).exists()) {
501            Gdx.app.debug("font", "Using internal font texture at " + texturePath);
502            tex = new Texture(Gdx.files.internal(texturePath), false);
503            tex.setFilter(Texture.TextureFilter.Linear, Texture.TextureFilter.Linear);
504        } else if (Gdx.files.classpath(texturePath).exists()) {
505            Gdx.app.debug("font", "Using classpath font texture at " + texturePath);
506            tex = new Texture(Gdx.files.classpath(texturePath), false);
507            tex.setFilter(Texture.TextureFilter.Linear, Texture.TextureFilter.Linear);
508        } else {
509            bmpFont = DefaultResources.getIncludedFont();
510            Gdx.app.error("TextCellFactory", "Could not find font file: " + texturePath + ", using defaults");
511            return this;
512        }
513        if (Gdx.files.internal(fontPath).exists()) {
514            Gdx.app.debug("font", "Using internal font at " + fontPath);
515            bmpFont = new BitmapFont(Gdx.files.internal(fontPath), new TextureRegion(tex), false);
516            distanceField = true;
517        } else if (Gdx.files.classpath(fontPath).exists()) {
518            Gdx.app.debug("font", "Using classpath font at " + fontPath);
519            bmpFont = new BitmapFont(Gdx.files.classpath(fontPath), new TextureRegion(tex), false);
520            distanceField = true;
521        } else {
522            bmpFont = DefaultResources.getIncludedFont();
523            Gdx.app.error("TextCellFactory", "Could not find font file: " + fontPath + ", using defaults");
524        }
525        //bmpFont.getData().padBottom = bmpFont.getDescent();
526        distanceFieldScaleX = bmpFont.getSpaceXadvance() - 1f;
527        distanceFieldScaleY = bmpFont.getLineHeight() - 1f;
528        return this;
529    }
530    /**
531     * @param fontPath the path to a .fnt bitmap font file with multi-channel distance field effects applied, which
532     *                 requires a complex process to create.
533     * @param texturePath the path to the texture used by the bitmap font
534     * @return this factory for method chaining
535     */
536    public TextCellFactory fontMultiDistanceField(String fontPath, String texturePath) {
537        Texture tex;
538        if (Gdx.files.internal(texturePath).exists()) {
539            Gdx.app.debug("font", "Using internal font texture at " + texturePath);
540            tex = new Texture(Gdx.files.internal(texturePath), Pixmap.Format.RGB888, false);
541            tex.setFilter(Texture.TextureFilter.Linear, Texture.TextureFilter.Linear);
542        } else if (Gdx.files.classpath(texturePath).exists()) {
543            Gdx.app.debug("font", "Using classpath font texture at " + texturePath);
544            tex = new Texture(Gdx.files.classpath(texturePath), Pixmap.Format.RGB888, false);
545            tex.setFilter(Texture.TextureFilter.Linear, Texture.TextureFilter.Linear);
546        } else {
547            bmpFont = DefaultResources.getIncludedFont();
548            Gdx.app.error("TextCellFactory", "Could not find font file: " + texturePath + ", using defaults");
549            return this;
550        }
551        if (Gdx.files.internal(fontPath).exists()) {
552            Gdx.app.debug("font", "Using internal font at " + fontPath);
553            bmpFont = new BitmapFont(Gdx.files.internal(fontPath), new TextureRegion(tex), false);
554            msdf = true;
555        } else if (Gdx.files.classpath(fontPath).exists()) {
556            Gdx.app.debug("font", "Using classpath font at " + fontPath);
557            bmpFont = new BitmapFont(Gdx.files.classpath(fontPath), new TextureRegion(tex), false);
558            msdf = true;
559        } else {
560            bmpFont = DefaultResources.getIncludedFont();
561            Gdx.app.error("TextCellFactory", "Could not find font file: " + fontPath + ", using defaults");
562        }
563        //bmpFont.getData().padBottom = bmpFont.getDescent();
564        if(msdf)
565        {
566            bmpFont.getData().setScale(0.75f, 1f);
567        }
568        distanceFieldScaleX = bmpFont.getSpaceXadvance() - 1f;
569        distanceFieldScaleY = bmpFont.getLineHeight() - 1f;
570        return this;
571    }
572    /**
573     * Sets this factory to use the one font included with libGDX, which is Arial at size 15 px. Does it correctly
574     * display when used in a grid? Probably not as well as you'd hope. You should probably get some of the assets that
575     * accompany SquidLib, and can be downloaded directly from GitHub (not available as one monolithic jar via Maven
576     * Central, but that lets you pick and choose individual assets). Get a .fnt and its matching .png file from
577     * https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/tree/master/assets and you can pass them to {@link #font(String)} or
578     * {@link #fontDistanceField(String, String)}.
579     *
580     * @return this factory for method chaining
581     */
582    public TextCellFactory includedFont()
583    {
584        bmpFont = DefaultResources.getIncludedFont();
585        return this;
586    }/**
587     * Sets this factory to use a default 12x24 font that supports Latin, Greek, Cyrillic, and many more, including
588     * box-drawing characters, zodiac signs, playing-card suits, and chess piece symbols. This is enough to support the
589     * output of anything that DungeonUtility can make for a dungeon or FakeLanguageGen can make for text with its
590     * defaults, which is difficult for any font to do. The box-drawing characters in this don't quite line up, and in
591     * some colors there may appear to be gaps (white text on black backgrounds will show it, but not much else).
592     *
593     * This is a way to complete a needed step; the font must be set before initializing, which can be done by a few
594     * methods in this class.
595     *
596     * @return this factory for method chaining
597     */
598    public TextCellFactory defaultFont()
599    {
600        bmpFont = DefaultResources.getLargeSmoothFont();
601        return this;
602    }
603    /**
604     * Sets this factory to use a default 12x24 font that renders very accurately, with no gaps between box-drawing
605     * characters and very geometric lines.
606     *
607     * This is a way to complete a needed step; the font must be set before initializing, which can be done by a few
608     * methods in this class.
609     *
610     * @return this factory for method chaining
611     */
612    public TextCellFactory defaultNarrowFont()
613    {
614        bmpFont = DefaultResources.getLargeNarrowFont();
615        return this;
616    }

619     * Sets this factory to use a default 12x12 font, which... is square, and doesn't look as bad as many square fonts
620     * do, plus it supports box-drawing characters with no gaps.
621     *
622     * This is a way to complete a needed step; the font must be set before initializing, which can be done by a few
623     * methods in this class.
624     *
625     * @return this factory for method chaining
626     */
627    public TextCellFactory defaultSquareFont()

633    /**
634     * Sets the TextCellFactory to use a square distance field font that will resize to whatever size you request.
635     * You must configure the shader if you use a distance field font, unless a class does it for you, like SquidLayers.
636     * The configureShader(Batch) method of this class can be used to set up the shader if you don't use SquidLayers;
637     * see its docs for more information.
638     * @return this TextCellFactory set to use a square distance field font
639     */
640    public TextCellFactory defaultDistanceFieldFont()
641    {
642        fontDistanceField(DefaultResources.distanceFieldSquare, DefaultResources.distanceFieldSquareTexture).setSmoothingMultiplier(2.50f);
643        return this;
644    }

648     * The configureShader(Batch) method of this class can be used to set up the shader if you don't use SquidLayers;
649     * see its docs for more information.

651     */
652    public TextCellFactory defaultNarrowDistanceFieldFont()
653    {

663    public float width() {
664        return width;
665    }

667    /**
668     * Sets the factory's cell width to the provided value. Clamps at 1 on the
669     * lower bound to ensure valid calculations.
670     *
671     * @param width the desired width
672     * @return this factory for method chaining
673     */
674    public TextCellFactory width(float width) {
675        this.width = Math.max(1, width);
676        actualCellWidth = this.width;
677        return this;
678    }

684     */
685    public float height() {
686        return height;
687    }

691     * lower bound to ensure valid calculations.

693     * @param height the desired width
694     * @return this factory for method chaining
695     */
696    public TextCellFactory height(float height) {
697        this.height = Math.max(1, height);
698        //modifiedHeight = this.height;
699        actualCellHeight = this.height;
700        return this;
701    }

707     * @return this factory for method chaining
708     */

710        this.width = Math.max(1, width);
711        return this;

719     * @return this factory for method chaining

721    public TextCellFactory tweakHeight(float height) {
722        this.height = Math.max(1, height);
723        //modifiedHeight = this.height;
724        return this;

727    /**
728     * Returns the current String that is used for sizing the cells.
729     * If you have called {@link #fitAll()}, this will include every char in
730     * the font. If instead you have called {@link #fit(String)} (potentially
731     * with {@link #addFit(String)}), then this will typically be a smaller
732     * String and may not include all chars in the font. If no method has set
733     * the fitting, it will default to {@link #SQUID_FITTING}.
734     *
735     * @return the String of fixed-width chars used for sizing calculations
736     */
737    public String fit() {
738        return fitting;
739    }
740
741    /**
742     * Sets the characters that will be guaranteed to fit as fixed-width to the provided ones.
743     * This will override any previously set string.
744     *
745     * @param fit the String of code points to size to
746     * @return this factory for method chaining
747     */
748    public TextCellFactory fit(String fit) {
749        fitting = fit;
750        bmpFont.setFixedWidthGlyphs(fitting);
751        width = bmpFont.getSpaceXadvance();
752        return this;
753    }
754
755    /**
756     * Sets all valid characters to be guaranteed to fit as fixed-width.
757     * This will override any previously set string.
758     *
759     * @return this factory for method chaining
760     */
761    public TextCellFactory fitAll() {
762        fitting = setAllFixedWidth(bmpFont);
763        width = bmpFont.getSpaceXadvance();
764        return this;
765    }
766
767    /**
768     * Adds the code points in the string to the list of characters that will be
769     * guaranteed to fit as fixed-width.
770     *
771     * @param fit the String of code points to size to
772     * @return this factory for method chaining
773     */
774    public TextCellFactory addFit(String fit) {
775        fitting += fit;
776        bmpFont.setFixedWidthGlyphs(fitting);
777        width = bmpFont.getSpaceXadvance();
778        return this;
779    }

787    public boolean antialias() {
788        return true;

800        return this;

897    /**
898     * @param icc
899     *            The color center to use. Should not be {@code null}.
900     * @return {@code this}
901     * @throws NullPointerException
902     *             If {@code icc} is {@code null}.
903     */
904    public TextCellFactory setColorCenter(IColorCenter<Color> icc) {
905        if (icc == null)
906            /* Better fail now than later */
907            throw new NullPointerException(
908                    "The color center should not be null in " + getClass().getSimpleName());
909        scc = icc;
910        return this;
911    }

913    /**
914     * Returns true if this factory is fully initialized and ready to build text cells.
915     *
916     * @return true if initialized
917     */
918    public boolean initialized() {
919        return initialized;
920    }
921
922    /**
923     * Returns true if the given character will fit inside the current cell
924     * dimensions with the current font.
925     *
926     * ISO Control characters, non-printing characters and invalid unicode
927     * characters are all considered by definition to fit.
928     *
929     * @param codepoint the codepoint of the char in question
930     * @return true if the char will fit, or if it is non-printing in some way; false otherwise
931     */
932    public boolean willFit(int codepoint) {
933        if (!initialized) {
934            throw new IllegalStateException("This factory has not yet been initialized!");
935        }
936
937        if (!Character.isValidCodePoint(codepoint) ||
938                (codepoint <= 0x001F) || (codepoint >= 0x007F && codepoint <= 0x009F)) // same as isIsoControl
939        {
940            return true;
941        }
942
943        return fitting.contains(String.valueOf(Character.toChars(codepoint)));
944    }
945    
946    private char getOrDefault(final char toGet)
947    {
948        return swap.getOrDefault(toGet, toGet);
949    }
950    /**
951     * Use the specified Batch to draw a String or other CharSequence (often just one char long) with the default color
952     * (white), with x and y determining the world-space coordinates for the upper-left corner.
953     *
954     * @param batch the libGDX Batch to do the drawing
955     * @param s the string to draw, often but not necessarily one char. Can be null to draw a solid block instead.
956     * @param x x of the upper-left corner of the region of text in world coordinates.
957     * @param y y of the upper-left corner of the region of text in world coordinates.
958     */
959    public void draw(Batch batch, CharSequence s, float x, float y) {
960        if (!initialized) {
961            throw new IllegalStateException("This factory has not yet been initialized!");
962        }
963
964        // + descent * 3 / 2f
965        // - distanceFieldScaleY / 12f
966
967        //height - lineTweak * 2f
968        if (s == null || s.length() == 0 || s.charAt(0) == 0) {
969            batch.setPackedColor(SColor.FLOAT_WHITE);
970            batch.draw(block, x, y - actualCellHeight, actualCellWidth, actualCellHeight); // + descent * 1 / 3f
971        } else {
972            batch.setPackedColor(SColor.FLOAT_WHITE); // round trip so FilterBatch can filter BitmapFontCache
973            Color.abgr8888ToColor(bmpFont.getColor(), batch.getPackedColor());
974            bmpFont.draw(batch, s, x, y - descent + 1/* * 1.5f*//* - lineHeight * 0.2f */ /* + descent*/, width, Align.center, false);
975        }
976    }
977
978
979    /**
980     * Use the specified Batch to draw a char with the default color (white), with x and y determining the world-space
981     * coordinates for the upper-left corner. If c is {@code '\0'}, will draw a solid white block instead.
982     *
983     * @param batch the libGDX Batch to do the drawing
984     * @param c the char to draw. Can be {@code '\0'} to draw a solid block instead.
985     * @param x x of the upper-left corner of the region of text in world coordinates.
986     * @param y y of the upper-left corner of the region of text in world coordinates.
987     */
988    public void draw(Batch batch, char c, float x, float y) {
989        if (!initialized) {
990            throw new IllegalStateException("This factory has not yet been initialized!");
991        }
992
993        // + descent * 3 / 2f
994        // - distanceFieldScaleY / 12f
995
996        //height - lineTweak * 2f
997        if (c == 0) {
998            batch.setColor(1f,1f,1f,1f);
999            batch.draw(block, x, y - actualCellHeight, actualCellWidth, actualCellHeight); // + descent * 1 / 3f
1000        } else {
1001            batch.setPackedColor(SColor.FLOAT_WHITE); // round trip so FilterBatch can filter BitmapFontCache
1002            Color.abgr8888ToColor(bmpFont.getColor(), batch.getPackedColor());
1003            mut.setCharAt(0, getOrDefault(c));
1004            bmpFont.draw(batch, mut, x, y - descent + 1/* * 1.5f*//* - lineHeight * 0.2f */ /* + descent*/, width, Align.center, false);
1005        }
1006    }
1007    /**
1008     * Use the specified Batch to draw a String or other CharSequence (often just one char long) in the specified rgba
1009     * color, with x and y determining the world-space coordinates for the upper-left corner.
1010     *
1011     * @param batch the libGDX Batch to do the drawing
1012     * @param s the string to draw, often but not necessarily one char. Can be null to draw a solid block instead.
1013     * @param r 0.0f to 1.0f red value
1014     * @param g 0.0f to 1.0f green value
1015     * @param b 0.0f to 1.0f blue value
1016     * @param a 0.0f to 1.0f alpha value
1017     * @param x x of the upper-left corner of the region of text in world coordinates.
1018     * @param y y of the upper-left corner of the region of text in world coordinates.
1019     */
1020    public void draw(Batch batch, CharSequence s, float r, float g, float b, float a, float x, float y) {
1021        if (!initialized) {
1022            throw new IllegalStateException("This factory has not yet been initialized!");
1023        }
1024
1025        if (s == null) {
1026            float orig = batch.getPackedColor();
1027            batch.setColor(r, g, b, a);
1028            batch.draw(block, x, y - actualCellHeight, actualCellWidth, actualCellHeight); // descent * 1 / 3f
1029            batch.setPackedColor(orig);
1030        } else if(s.length() > 0 && s.charAt(0) == '\0') {
1031            float orig = batch.getPackedColor();
1032            batch.setColor(r, g, b, a);
1033            batch.draw(block, x, y - actualCellHeight, actualCellWidth * s.length(), actualCellHeight);
1034            batch.setPackedColor(orig);
1035        } else {
1036            batch.setColor(r, g, b, a); // round trip so FilterBatch can filter BitmapFontCache
1037            Color.abgr8888ToColor(bmpFont.getColor(), batch.getPackedColor());
1038            bmpFont.draw(batch, s, x, y - descent + 1, width, Align.center, false);
1039        }
1040    }
1041
1042    /**
1043     * Use the specified Batch to draw a String or other CharSequence (often just one char long) in the specified libGDX
1044     * Color, with x and y
1045     * determining the world-space coordinates for the upper-left corner.
1046     *
1047     * @param batch the libGDX Batch to do the drawing
1048     * @param s the string to draw, often but not necessarily one char. Can be null to draw a solid block instead.
1049     * @param color the libGDX Color to draw the char(s) with, all the same color
1050     * @param x x of the upper-left corner of the region of text in world coordinates.
1051     * @param y y of the upper-left corner of the region of text in world coordinates.
1052     */
1053    public void draw(Batch batch, CharSequence s, Color color, float x, float y) {
1054        if (!initialized) {
1055            throw new IllegalStateException("This factory has not yet been initialized!");
1056        }
1057
1058        if (s == null) {
1059            float orig = batch.getPackedColor();
1060            batch.setColor(color);
1061            batch.draw(block, x, y - actualCellHeight, actualCellWidth, actualCellHeight);
1062            batch.setPackedColor(orig);
1063        } else if(s.length() > 0 && s.charAt(0) == '\0') {
1064            float orig = batch.getPackedColor();
1065            batch.setColor(color);
1066            batch.draw(block, x, y - actualCellHeight, actualCellWidth * s.length(), actualCellHeight);
1067            batch.setPackedColor(orig);
1068        } else {
1069            batch.setColor(color); // round trip so FilterBatch can filter BitmapFontCache
1070            Color.abgr8888ToColor(bmpFont.getColor(), batch.getPackedColor());
1071            bmpFont.draw(batch, s, x, y - descent + 1, width, Align.center, false);
1072        }
1073    }
1074    /**
1075     * Use the specified Batch to draw a String or other CharSequence (often just one char long) in the specified libGDX
1076     * Color, with x and y determining the world-space coordinates for the upper-left corner.
1077     *
1078     * @param batch the libGDX Batch to do the drawing
1079     * @param s the string to draw, often but not necessarily one char. Can be null to draw a solid block instead.
1080     * @param encodedColor the libGDX Color to use, converted to float as by {@link Color#toFloatBits()}
1081     * @param x x of the upper-left corner of the region of text in world coordinates.
1082     * @param y y of the upper-left corner of the region of text in world coordinates.
1083     */
1084    public void draw(Batch batch, CharSequence s, float encodedColor, float x, float y) {
1085        if (!initialized) {
1086            throw new IllegalStateException("This factory has not yet been initialized!");
1087        }
1088
1089        if (s == null) {
1090            float orig = batch.getPackedColor();
1091            batch.setPackedColor(encodedColor);
1092            batch.draw(block, x, y - actualCellHeight, actualCellWidth, actualCellHeight);
1093            batch.setPackedColor(orig);
1094        } else if(s.length() > 0 && s.charAt(0) == '\0') {
1095            float orig = batch.getPackedColor();
1096            batch.setPackedColor(encodedColor);
1097            batch.draw(block, x, y - actualCellHeight, actualCellWidth * s.length(), actualCellHeight);
1098            batch.setPackedColor(orig);
1099        } else
1100        {
1101            batch.setPackedColor(encodedColor); // round trip so FilterBatch can filter BitmapFontCache
1102            Color.abgr8888ToColor(bmpFont.getColor(), batch.getPackedColor());
1103            bmpFont.draw(batch, s, x, y - descent + 1, width, Align.center, false);
1104        }
1105    }
1106
1107    /**
1108     * Use the specified Batch to draw a char in the specified libGDX Color, with x and y
1109     * determining the world-space coordinates for the upper-left corner.
1110     *
1111     * @param batch the libGDX Batch to do the drawing
1112     * @param c the char to draw. Can be {@code '\0'} to draw a solid block instead.
1113     * @param color the libGDX Color (or SquidLib SColor) to use, as an object
1114     * @param x x of the upper-left corner of the region of text in world coordinates.
1115     * @param y y of the upper-left corner of the region of text in world coordinates.
1116     */
1117    public void draw(Batch batch, char c, Color color, float x, float y) {
1118        if (!initialized) {
1119            throw new IllegalStateException("This factory has not yet been initialized!");
1120        }
1121        if (c == 0) {
1122            float orig = batch.getPackedColor();
1123            batch.setColor(color);
1124            batch.draw(block, x, y - actualCellHeight, actualCellWidth, actualCellHeight);
1125            batch.setPackedColor(orig);
1126        } else
1127        {
1128            batch.setColor(color); // round trip so FilterBatch can filter BitmapFontCache
1129            Color.abgr8888ToColor(bmpFont.getColor(), batch.getPackedColor());
1130            mut.setCharAt(0, getOrDefault(c));
1131            bmpFont.draw(batch, mut, x, y - descent + 1, width, Align.center, false);
1132        }
1133    }
1134
1135    /**
1136     * Use the specified Batch to draw a String (often just one char long) in the specified libGDX Color, with x and y
1137     * determining the world-space coordinates for the upper-left corner.
1138     *
1139     * @param batch the libGDX Batch to do the drawing
1140     * @param c the char to draw. Can be {@code '\0'} to draw a solid block instead.
1141     * @param encodedColor the libGDX Color to use, converted to float as by {@link Color#toFloatBits()}
1142     * @param x x of the upper-left corner of the region of text in world coordinates.
1143     * @param y y of the upper-left corner of the region of text in world coordinates.
1144     */
1145    public void draw(Batch batch, char c, float encodedColor, float x, float y) {
1146        if (!initialized) {
1147            throw new IllegalStateException("This factory has not yet been initialized!");
1148        }
1149        if (c == 0) {
1150            float orig = batch.getPackedColor();
1151            batch.setPackedColor(encodedColor);
1152            batch.draw(block, x, y - actualCellHeight, actualCellWidth, actualCellHeight);
1153            batch.setPackedColor(orig);
1154        } else
1155        {
1156            batch.setPackedColor(encodedColor); // round trip so FilterBatch can filter BitmapFontCache
1157            Color.abgr8888ToColor(bmpFont.getColor(), batch.getPackedColor());
1158            mut.setCharAt(0, getOrDefault(c));
1159            bmpFont.draw(batch, mut, x, y - descent + 1, width, Align.center, false);
1160        }
1161    }

1164     * Use the specified Batch to draw a TextureRegion with the default tint color (white, so un-tinted), with x and y
1165     * determining the world-space coordinates for the upper-left corner. The TextureRegion will be stretched
1166     * if its size does not match what this TextCellFactory uses for width and height.
1167     *

1169     * @param tr the TextureRegion to draw. Can be null to draw a solid block instead.
1170     * @param x x of the upper-left corner of the region of text in world coordinates.
1171     * @param y y of the upper-left corner of the region of text in world coordinates.
1172     */
1173    public void draw(Batch batch, TextureRegion tr, float x, float y) {

1175            throw new IllegalStateException("This factory has not yet been initialized!");
1176        }
1177
1178        if (tr == null) {
1179            batch.draw(block, x, y - height, actualCellWidth, actualCellHeight);
1180        } else {
1181            batch.draw(tr, x, y - height, width, height);
1182        }
1183    }

1256     * @param y y of the upper-left corner of the image in world coordinates.
1257     */

1373     * @param x x of the upper-left corner of the image in world coordinates.
1374     * @param y y of the upper-left corner of the image in world coordinates.

1395
1396    /**
1397     * Draws a 2D array of floats that represent encoded colors, with each float used for a block of color the size of
1398     * one character cell (it will be {@link #actualCellWidth} by {@link #actualCellHeight} in size, using world units).
1399     * @param batch the libGDX Batch to do the drawing
1400     * @param encodedColors a 2D float array of encoded colors, each usually produced by {@link Color#toFloatBits()} or an SColor method
1401     * @param x the x-position where this should render the block of many colors 
1402     * @param y the y-position where this should render the block of many colors
1403     */
1404    public void draw(Batch batch, float[][] encodedColors, float x, float y)
1405    {
1406        float orig = batch.getPackedColor();
1407        final int w = encodedColors.length, h = encodedColors[0].length;
1408        float wm = x, hm;
1409        for (int i = 0; i < w; i++, wm += actualCellWidth) {
1410            hm = y + (h - 1) * actualCellHeight;
1411            for (int j = 0; j < h; j++, hm -= actualCellHeight) {
1412                if(encodedColors[i][j] == 0f)
1413                    continue;
1414                batch.setPackedColor(encodedColors[i][j]);
1415                batch.draw(block, wm, hm, actualCellWidth, actualCellHeight); // descent * 1 / 3f
1416            }
1417        }
1418        batch.setPackedColor(orig);
1419    }
1420
1421    /**
1422     * Draws a 2D array of floats that represent encoded colors, with each float used for a block of color that will be
1423     * a fraction of the size of one character cell (it will be {@link #actualCellWidth} divided by {@code xSubCells} by
1424     * {@link #actualCellHeight} divided by {@code ySubCells} in size, using world units). Typically the 2D float array
1425     * should be larger than the 2D storage for text drawn over the colorful blocks (such as a 2D char array), since
1426     * more than one subcell may be drawn in the space of one character cell.
1427     * @param batch the libGDX Batch to do the drawing
1428     * @param encodedColors a 2D float array of encoded colors, each usually produced by {@link Color#toFloatBits()} or an SColor method
1429     * @param x the x-position where this should render the block of many colors 
1430     * @param y the y-position where this should render the block of many colors
1431     * @param xSubCells how many blocks of color should fit across the span of {@link #actualCellWidth}, each one float; must not be 0
1432     * @param ySubCells how many blocks of color should fit across the span of {@link #actualCellHeight}, each one float; must not be 0
1433     */
1434    public void draw(Batch batch, float[][] encodedColors, float x, float y, int xSubCells, int ySubCells)
1435    {
1436        float orig = batch.getPackedColor();
1437        final int w = encodedColors.length, h = encodedColors[0].length;
1438        final float subW = actualCellWidth / xSubCells, subH = actualCellHeight / ySubCells;
1439        float wm = x, hm;
1440        for (int i = 0; i < w; i++, wm += subW) {
1441            hm = y + (h - 1) * subH;
1442            for (int j = 0; j < h; j++, hm -= subH) {
1443                if(encodedColors[i][j] == 0f)
1444                    continue;
1445                batch.setPackedColor(encodedColors[i][j]);
1446                batch.draw(block, wm, hm, subW, subH);
1447            }
1448        }
1449        batch.setPackedColor(orig);
1450    }
1451
1452    /**
1453     * Given a Pixmap and a 2D float array, uses each float in the array as an encoded color for a pixel in the Pixmap
1454     * at a location determined by the float's position in the array. This is meant to be used to draw backgrounds that
1455     * will be stretched by the {@link #actualCellWidth} and {@link #actualCellHeight} of this TextCellFactory.
1456     * <br>
1457     * Oddly, this doesn't seem to be very fast compared to {@link #draw(Batch, float[][], float, float)}, so if you
1458     * need to draw backgrounds then prefer that method (as SparseLayers does). It also doesn't work with a FilterBatch,
1459     * so if you want to use FloatFilter to adjust colors, you would need to use the other draw method for backgrounds.
1460     * @param pixmap a non-null Pixmap that will be modified
1461     * @param encodedColors a 2D float array that must be non-null and non-empty, and contains packed colors
1462     */
1463    public void draw(Pixmap pixmap, float[][] encodedColors)
1464    {
1465        final int w = Math.min(pixmap.getWidth(), encodedColors.length), h = Math.min(pixmap.getHeight(), encodedColors[0].length);
1466        for (int i = 0; i < w; i++) {
1467            for (int j = h - 1; j >= 0; j--) {
1468                if (encodedColors[i][j] == 0f)
1469                    continue;
1470                pixmap.drawPixel(i, j, NumberTools.floatToReversedIntBits(encodedColors[i][j]));
1471            }
1472        }
1473    }
1474
1475    /**
1476     * Converts a String into a Label, or if the argument s is null, creates an Image of a solid block. Can be used
1477     * for preparing glyphs for animation effects.
1478     * @param s a String to make into an Actor, which can be null for a solid block.
1479     * @return the Actor, with no position set.
1480     */
1481    public Label makeWrappingString(String s) {
1482        if (!initialized) {
1483            throw new IllegalStateException("This factory has not yet been initialized!");
1484        }
1485        if (s == null) {
1486            s = "";
1487        }
1488        Label lb = new Label(s, style);
1489        lb.setWrap(true);
1490        // lb.setPosition(x - width * 0.5f, y - height * 0.5f, Align.center);
1491        return lb;
1492
1493    }
1494
1495    /**
1496     * Converts a String into a Label, or if the argument s is null, creates an Image of a solid block. Can be used
1497     * for preparing glyphs for animation effects, and is used internally for this purpose.
1498     * @param s a String to make into an Actor, which can be null for a solid block.
1499     * @param color a Color to tint s with.
1500     * @return the Actor, with no position set.
1501     */
1502    public Actor makeActor(String s, Color color) {
1503        if (!initialized) {
1504            throw new IllegalStateException("This factory has not yet been initialized!");
1505        }
1506        if (s == null) {
1507            Image im = new Image(block);
1508            im.setColor(scc.filter(color));
1509            //im.setSize(width, height - MathUtils.ceil(bmpFont.getDescent() / 2f));
1510            im.setSize(actualCellWidth, actualCellHeight + (distanceField ? 1 : 0)); //  - lineHeight / actualCellHeight //+ lineTweak * 1f
1511            // im.setPosition(x - width * 0.5f, y - height * 0.5f, Align.center);
1512            return im;
1513        } else if(s.length() > 0 && s.charAt(0) == '\0') {
1514            Image im = new Image(block);
1515            im.setColor(scc.filter(color));
1516            //im.setSize(width * s.length(), height - MathUtils.ceil(bmpFont.getDescent() / 2f));
1517            im.setSize(actualCellWidth * s.length(), actualCellHeight + (distanceField ? 1 : 0)); //   - lineHeight / actualCellHeight //+ lineTweak * 1f
1518            // im.setPosition(x - width * 0.5f, y - height * 0.5f, Align.center);
1519            return im;
1520        } else {
1521            Label lb = new Label(s, style);
1522            //lb.setFontScale(bmpFont.getData().scaleX, bmpFont.getData().scaleY);
1523            lb.setSize(width * s.length(), height - descent); //+ lineTweak * 1f
1524            lb.setColor(scc.filter(color));
1525            // lb.setPosition(x - width * 0.5f, y - height * 0.5f, Align.center);
1526            return lb;
1527        }
1528    }
1529
1530    /**
1531     * Converts a String into a ColorChangeLabel, or if the argument s is null, creates a ColorChangeImage of a solid
1532     * block. Can be used for preparing glyphs for animation effects, and is used internally for this purpose. The
1533     * ColorChange classes will rotate between all colors given in the List each second, and are not affected by setColor,
1534     * though they are affected by their setColors methods. Their color change is not considered an animation for the
1535     * purposes of things like SquidPanel.hasActiveAnimations() .
1536     * @param s a String to make into an Actor, which can be null for a solid block.
1537     * @param colors a List of Color to tint s with, looping through all elements in the list each second
1538     * @return the Actor, with no position set.
1539     */
1540    public Actor makeActor(String s, Collection<Color> colors) {
1541        return makeActor(s, colors, 2f, false);
1542    }
1543    /**
1544     * Converts a String into a ColorChangeLabel, or if the argument s is null, creates a ColorChangeImage of a solid
1545     * block. Can be used for preparing glyphs for animation effects, and is used internally for this purpose. The
1546     * ColorChange classes will rotate between all colors given in the List each second, and are not affected by setColor,
1547     * though they are affected by their setColors methods. Their color change is not considered an animation for the
1548     * purposes of things like SquidPanel.hasActiveAnimations() .
1549     * @param s a String to make into an Actor, which can be null for a solid block.
1550     * @param colors a List of Color to tint s with, looping through all elements in the list each second
1551     * @param loopTime the amount of time, in seconds, to spend looping through all colors in the list
1552     * @return the Actor, with no position set.
1553     */
1554    public Actor makeActor(String s, Collection<Color> colors, float loopTime)
1555    {
1556        return makeActor(s, colors, loopTime, false);
1557    }
1558    /**
1559     * Converts a String into a ColorChangeLabel, or if the argument s is null, creates a ColorChangeImage of a solid
1560     * block. Can be used for preparing glyphs for animation effects, and is used internally for this purpose. The
1561     * ColorChange classes will rotate between all colors given in the List each second, and are not affected by setColor,
1562     * though they are affected by their setColors methods. Their color change is not considered an animation for the
1563     * purposes of things like SquidPanel.hasActiveAnimations() .
1564     * @param s a String to make into an Actor, which can be null for a solid block.
1565     * @param colors a List of Color to tint s with, looping through all elements in the list each second
1566     * @param loopTime the amount of time, in seconds, to spend looping through all colors in the list
1567     * @return the Actor, with no position set.
1568     */
1569    public Actor makeActor(String s, Collection<Color> colors, float loopTime, boolean doubleWidth) {
1570        if (!initialized) {
1571            throw new IllegalStateException("This factory has not yet been initialized!");
1572        }
1573        ArrayList<Color> colors2 = null;
1574        if(colors != null && !colors.isEmpty())
1575        {
1576            colors2 = new ArrayList<>(colors.size());
1577            for (Color c : colors) {
1578                colors2.add(scc.filter(c));
1579            }
1580        }
1581        if (s == null) {
1582            ColorChangeImage im = new ColorChangeImage(block, loopTime, doubleWidth, colors2);
1583            //im.setSize(width, height - MathUtils.ceil(bmpFont.getDescent() / 2f));
1584            im.setSize(actualCellWidth * (doubleWidth ? 2 : 1), actualCellHeight + (distanceField ? 1 : 0)); //  - lineHeight / actualCellHeight //+ lineTweak * 1f
1585            // im.setPosition(x - width * 0.5f, y - height * 0.5f, Align.center);
1586            return im;
1587        } else if(s.length() > 0 && s.charAt(0) == '\0') {
1588            ColorChangeImage im = new ColorChangeImage(block, loopTime, doubleWidth, colors2);
1589            //im.setSize(width * s.length(), height - MathUtils.ceil(bmpFont.getDescent() / 2f));
1590            im.setSize(actualCellWidth * s.length() * (doubleWidth ? 2 : 1), actualCellHeight + (distanceField ? 1 : 0)); //   - lineHeight / actualCellHeight //+ lineTweak * 1f
1591            // im.setPosition(x - width * 0.5f, y - height * 0.5f, Align.center);
1592            return im;
1593        } else {
1594            ColorChangeLabel lb = new ColorChangeLabel(s, style, loopTime, doubleWidth, colors2);
1595            lb.setSize(width * s.length(), height - descent); //+ lineTweak * 1f
1596            // lb.setPosition(x - width * 0.5f, y - height * 0.5f, Align.center);
1597            return lb;
1598        }
1599    }
1600
1601    /**
1602     * Converts a char into a Label, or if the argument c is '\0', creates an Image of a solid block. Can be used
1603     * for preparing glyphs for animation effects, and is used internally for this purpose.
1604     * @param c a char to make into an Actor, which can be the character with Unicode value 0 for a solid block.
1605     * @param color a Color to tint c with.
1606     * @return the Actor, with no position set.
1607     */
1608    public Actor makeActor(char c, Color color) {
1609        if (!initialized) {
1610            throw new IllegalStateException("This factory has not yet been initialized!");
1611        }
1612        if (c == 0) {
1613            Image im = new Image(block);
1614            im.setColor(scc.filter(color));
1615            //im.setSize(width, height - MathUtils.ceil(bmpFont.getDescent() / 2f));
1616            im.setSize(actualCellWidth, actualCellHeight + (distanceField ? 1 : 0)); //  - lineHeight / actualCellHeight //+ lineTweak * 1f
1617            // im.setPosition(x - width * 0.5f, y - height * 0.5f, Align.center);
1618            return im;
1619        } else {
1620            mut.setCharAt(0, getOrDefault(c));
1621            Label lb = new Label(mut, style);
1622            lb.setSize(width, height - descent); //+ lineTweak * 1f
1623            lb.setColor(scc.filter(color));
1624            return lb;
1625        }
1626    }
1627
1628    /**
1629     * Converts a char into a Label, or if the argument c is '\0', creates an Image of a solid block. Can be used
1630     * for preparing glyphs for animation effects, and is used internally for this purpose. Instead of a libGDX Color
1631     * object, this takes an encoded float that represents a color as libGDX often does internally, ABGR-packed format.
1632     * You can use various methods in SColor to produce these, like {@link SColor#floatGet(float, float, float, float)}
1633     * or {@link Color#toFloatBits()}.
1634     * @param c a char to make into an Actor, which can be the character with Unicode value 0 for a solid block.
1635     * @param encodedColor an ABGR packed float (as produced by {@link SColor#floatGet(float, float, float, float)}) to use as c's color
1636     * @return the Actor, with no position set.
1637     */
1638    public Actor makeActor(char c, float encodedColor) {
1639        if (!initialized) {
1640            throw new IllegalStateException("This factory has not yet been initialized!");
1641        }
1642        if (c == 0) {
1643            Image im = new Image(block);
1644            Color.abgr8888ToColor(im.getColor(), encodedColor);
1645            //im.setSize(width, height - MathUtils.ceil(bmpFont.getDescent() / 2f));
1646            im.setSize(actualCellWidth, actualCellHeight + (distanceField ? 1 : 0)); //  - lineHeight / actualCellHeight //+ lineTweak * 1f
1647            // im.setPosition(x - width * 0.5f, y - height * 0.5f, Align.center);
1648            return im;
1649        } else {
1650            mut.setCharAt(0, getOrDefault(c));
1651            Label lb = new Label(mut, style);
1652            //lb.setFontScale(bmpFont.getData().scaleX, bmpFont.getData().scaleY);
1653            lb.setSize(width, height - descent); //+ lineTweak * 1f
1654            Color.abgr8888ToColor(lb.getColor(), encodedColor);
1655            // lb.setPosition(x - width * 0.5f, y - height * 0.5f, Align.center);
1656            return lb;
1657        }
1658    }
1659
1660    /**
1661     * Converts a char into a ColorChangeLabel, or if the argument c is '\0', creates a ColorChangeImage of a solid
1662     * block. Can be used for preparing glyphs for animation effects, and is used internally for this purpose. The
1663     * ColorChange classes will rotate between all colors given in the List each second, and are not affected by setColor,
1664     * though they are affected by their setColors methods. Their color change is not considered an animation for the
1665     * purposes of things like SquidPanel.hasActiveAnimations() .
1666     * @param c a char to make into an Actor, which can be the character with Unicode value 0 for a solid block.
1667     * @param colors a List of Color to tint c with, looping through all elements in the list each second
1668     * @return the Actor, with no position set.
1669     */
1670    public Actor makeActor(char c, Collection<Color> colors) {
1671        return makeActor(c, colors, 2f, false);
1672    }
1673    /**
1674     * Converts a char into a ColorChangeLabel, or if the argument c is '\0', creates a ColorChangeImage of a solid
1675     * block. Can be used for preparing glyphs for animation effects, and is used internally for this purpose. The
1676     * ColorChange classes will rotate between all colors given in the List each second, and are not affected by setColor,
1677     * though they are affected by their setColors methods. Their color change is not considered an animation for the
1678     * purposes of things like SquidPanel.hasActiveAnimations() .
1679     * @param c a char to make into an Actor, which can be the character with Unicode value 0 for a solid block.
1680     * @param colors a List of Color to tint c with, looping through all elements in the list each second
1681     * @param loopTime the amount of time, in seconds, to spend looping through all colors in the list
1682     * @return the Actor, with no position set.
1683     */
1684    public Actor makeActor(char c, Collection<Color> colors, float loopTime)
1685    {
1686        return makeActor(c, colors, loopTime, false);
1687    }
1688    /**
1689     * Converts a char into a ColorChangeLabel, or if the argument c is '\0', creates a ColorChangeImage of a solid
1690     * block. Can be used for preparing glyphs for animation effects, and is used internally for this purpose. The
1691     * ColorChange classes will rotate between all colors given in the List each second, and are not affected by setColor,
1692     * though they are affected by their setColors methods. Their color change is not considered an animation for the
1693     * purposes of things like SquidPanel.hasActiveAnimations() .
1694     * @param c a char to make into an Actor, which can be the character with Unicode value 0 for a solid block.
1695     * @param colors a List of Color to tint c with, looping through all elements in the list each second
1696     * @param loopTime the amount of time, in seconds, to spend looping through all colors in the list
1697     * @return the Actor, with no position set.
1698     */
1699    public Actor makeActor(char c, Collection<Color> colors, float loopTime, boolean doubleWidth) {
1700        if (!initialized) {
1701            throw new IllegalStateException("This factory has not yet been initialized!");
1702        }
1703        ArrayList<Color> colors2 = null;
1704        if(colors != null && !colors.isEmpty())
1705        {
1706            colors2 = new ArrayList<>(colors.size());
1707            for (Color color : colors) {
1708                colors2.add(scc.filter(color));
1709            }
1710        }
1711        if (c == 0) {
1712            ColorChangeImage im = new ColorChangeImage(block, loopTime, doubleWidth, colors2);
1713            //im.setSize(width, height - MathUtils.ceil(bmpFont.getDescent() / 2f));
1714            im.setSize(actualCellWidth * (doubleWidth ? 2 : 1), actualCellHeight + (distanceField ? 1 : 0)); //  - lineHeight / actualCellHeight //+ lineTweak * 1f
1715            // im.setPosition(x - width * 0.5f, y - height * 0.5f, Align.center);
1716            return im;
1717        } else {
1718            mut.setCharAt(0, getOrDefault(c));
1719            ColorChangeLabel lb = new ColorChangeLabel(mut, style, loopTime, doubleWidth, colors2);
1720            lb.setSize(width, height - descent); //+ lineTweak * 1f
1721            // lb.setPosition(x - width * 0.5f, y - height * 0.5f, Align.center);
1722            return lb;
1723        }
1724    }
1725    public Actor makeActor(TextureRegion tr, Collection<Color> colors)
1726    {
1727        return makeActor(tr, colors, 2f, false);
1728    }
1729    public Actor makeActor(TextureRegion tr, Collection<Color> colors, float loopTime)
1730    {
1731        return makeActor(tr, colors, loopTime, false);
1732    }
1733    /**
1734     * Converts a TextureRegion into a ColorChangeImage that will cycle through the given colors.
1735     * ColorChange classes will rotate between all colors given in the List each loopTime, and are not affected by
1736     * setColor, though they are affected by their setColors methods. Their color change is not considered an animation
1737     * for the purposes of things like SquidPanel.hasActiveAnimations() .
1738     * @param tr a TextureRegion to make into an Actor, which can be null for a solid block.
1739     * @param colors a List of Color to tint c with, looping through all elements in the list each second
1740     * @param loopTime the amount of time, in seconds, to spend looping through all colors in the list
1741     * @return the Actor, with no position set.
1742     */
1743    public Actor makeActor(TextureRegion tr, Collection<Color> colors, float loopTime, boolean doubleWidth){
1744        return makeActor(tr, colors, loopTime, doubleWidth,
1745                actualCellWidth * (doubleWidth ? 2 : 1), actualCellHeight + (distanceField ? 1 : 0));
1746    }
1747
1748    /**
1749     * Converts a TextureRegion into a ColorChangeImage that will cycle through the given colors.
1750     * ColorChange classes will rotate between all colors given in the List each loopTime, and are not affected by
1751     * setColor, though they are affected by their setColors methods. Their color change is not considered an animation
1752     * for the purposes of things like SquidPanel.hasActiveAnimations() .
1753     * @param tr a TextureRegion to make into an Actor, which can be null for a solid block.
1754     * @param colors a List of Color to tint c with, looping through all elements in the list each second
1755     * @param loopTime the amount of time, in seconds, to spend looping through all colors in the list
1756     * @return the Actor, with no position set.
1757     */
1758    public Actor makeActor(TextureRegion tr, Collection<Color> colors, float loopTime, boolean doubleWidth,
1759                           float width, float height){
1760        if (!initialized) {
1761            throw new IllegalStateException("This factory has not yet been initialized!");
1762        }
1763        ArrayList<Color> colors2 = null;
1764        if(colors != null && !colors.isEmpty())
1765        {
1766            colors2 = new ArrayList<>(colors.size());
1767            for (Color color : colors) {
1768                colors2.add(scc.filter(color));
1769            }
1770        }
1771        if (tr == null) {
1772            ColorChangeImage im = new ColorChangeImage(block, loopTime, doubleWidth, colors2);
1773            im.setSize(width, height);
1774            return im;
1775        } else {
1776            ColorChangeImage im = new ColorChangeImage(tr, loopTime, doubleWidth, colors2);
1777            im.setSize(width, height);
1778            return im;
1779        }
1780    }

1782    /**
1783     * Creates a ColorChangeImage Actor that should look like the glyph '^' in this font, but will be rotate-able. The
1784     * ColorChange classes will rotate between all colors given in the List in the given amount of loopTime, and are not
1785     * affected by setColor, though they are affected by their setColors methods. Their color change is not considered
1786     * an animation for the purposes of things like SquidPanel.hasActiveAnimations() .
1787     * @param colors a List of Color to tint the '^' with, looping through all elements in the list each second
1788     * @param loopTime the amount of time, in seconds, to spend looping through all colors in the list
1789     * @return the Actor, with no position set.
1790     */
1791    public Image makeDirectionMarker(Collection<Color> colors, float loopTime, boolean doubleWidth) {
1792        if (!initialized) {
1793            throw new IllegalStateException("This factory has not yet been initialized!");
1794        }
1795        ArrayList<Color> colors2 = null;
1796        if (colors != null && !colors.isEmpty()) {
1797            colors2 = new ArrayList<>(colors.size());
1798            for (Color c : colors) {
1799                colors2.add(scc.filter(c));
1800            }
1801        }
1802        ColorChangeImage im = new ColorChangeImage(dirMarker, loopTime, doubleWidth,
1803                actualCellWidth, actualCellHeight + (distanceField ? 1 : 0), colors2);
1804        im.setAlign(2);
1805        im.setSize(actualCellWidth * (doubleWidth ? 2 : 1), actualCellHeight + (distanceField ? 1 : 0)); //  - lineHeight / actualCellHeight //+ lineTweak * 1f
1806        return im;
1807    }
1808    /**
1809     * Creates a Image Actor that should look like the glyph '^' in this font, but will be rotate-able.
1810     * @param color a Color to tint the '^' with
1811     * @return the Actor, with no position set.
1812     */
1813    public Image makeDirectionMarker(Color color) {
1814        if (!initialized) {
1815            throw new IllegalStateException("This factory has not yet been initialized!");
1816        }
1817        Image im = new Image(dirMarker);
1818        im.setColor(scc.filter(color));
1819        im.setSize(actualCellWidth, actualCellHeight + (distanceField ? 1 : 0)); //  - lineHeight / actualCellHeight //+ lineTweak * 1f
1820        im.setOrigin(1); //center
1821        return im;
1822    }
